alert.note: Alert for Custer; El Paso; Fremont; Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 29 at 7:35AM MST until November 29 at 8:15AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Fremont County in central Colorado... Northeastern Custer County in southeastern Colorado... South central El Paso County in east central Colorado... Northern Pueblo County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 815 AM MST. * At 732 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Pinon, or 8 miles north of Pueblo, moving east at 45 mph. This snow squall will affect the I-25 and US-50 corridors in the Pueblo region. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Whiteout conditions were reported along I-25. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Pueblo, northeastern Junkins Burn Scar, Pueblo Reservoir, Salt Creek, Blende, Pueblo West, Pueblo Depot, Pinon, Penrose and Wetmore. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
